pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:0.5: 66. The training rule on a group of traveling thieves
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.2: a certain group of travelers was about to go south from Rājagaha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.3: A monk said to those people,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.10: caught the group, confiscated the goods, and asked that monk,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.11: “Venerable, why are you knowingly traveling with a group of thieves?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.13: After being released, that monk went to Sāvatthī, where he told the monks what had happened.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.14: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.15: “How could a monk knowingly travel by appointment with a group of thieves?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.16: “Is it true, monk, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.19: “… Foolish man, how could you do this?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.20: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.21: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.22.1: ‘If a monk knowingly travels by appointment with a group of thieves, even just to the next village, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.1.6: he knows by himself or others have told him or the group of travelers has told him.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.1.8: thieves who have done their deed or thieves who have not. They are stealing from the king or smuggling.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.1.12: if he makes an appointment like this: the monk says, “Let’s go,” and they reply, “Yes, let’s go, Venerable;” or they say, “Let’s go, Venerable,” and the monk replies, “Yes, let’s go;” or the monk says, “Let’s go today,” “Let’s go tomorrow,” or “Let’s go the day after tomorrow,” then he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.1.13: Even just to the next village:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.1.14: when the villages are a chicken’s flight apart, then for every next village he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.1.15: When it is an uninhabited area, a wilderness, then for every six kilometers he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.2.1: If it is a group of traveling thieves, and he perceives it as such, and he travels by appointment with them, even just to the next village, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.2.2: If it is a group of traveling thieves, but he is unsure of it, and he travels by appointment with them, even just to the next village, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.2.3: If it is a group of traveling thieves, but he does not perceive it as such, and he travels by appointment with them, even just to the next village, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.2.4: If the monk makes an appointment, but the group does not express its agreement, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.2.5: If it is not a group of traveling thieves, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.2.6: If it is not a group of traveling thieves, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.2.7: If it is not a group of traveling thieves, and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.3.2: if he goes, but not by appointment;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.3.3: if the group has made an appointment, but he has not expressed his agreement;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.3.4: if he goes, but not according to the appointment;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.3.7: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.3.8: The sixth rule, the training rule on a group of traveling thieves, is finished.
